reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed a couple of nights at The Eltermere Inn and really enjoyed our stay. We had the "Deer Bields" room on the top floor, this is one of their superior plus rooms and was very spacious and well appointed apart from the bathroom. The toilet / basin room was extremely compact with a low ceiling under the eaves and the freestanding bath tub whilst looking very impressive was a bit of a pain, nowhere to attach the shower head, nowhere to put shampoo etc. Everything else about the hotel was really lovely, the various sitting rooms where the attentive staff would serve coffee, and the dining room were all beautifully furnished. We ate in the bar one night (same menu) as we were only 1 of 2 couples dining and the food was delicious as was the breakfast. We also ate out at the local pub, The Britannia Inn, which is just a short walk and this is also good. Traditional lakeland pub with good bar food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband decided to have lunch out this Saturday and discovered the lovely Eltermere Inn in the Langdale are of the Lake District. It was a delightful find, the place itself is in a great location so we tied it in with a walk first. We were the only ones having lunch when we arrived and got a warm welcome from the person in charge of the bar. We chose pea & ham soup for me, Club sandich for my husband. Both were truly delicious. The best pea & ham soup I've ever had, with an excellent selection of artisan bread to go with it. My husband is still raving about his club sandwith, filled with plenty of bacon, chicken and salad and a handful of chips to go with it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a 1 night stay at the Eltermere Inn and it really was 'perfect in every sense'. We arrived early on Sunday and was pleased to find our room was ready. After quickly depositing our bags in the delightful Superior Plus 'Cockly Moss' room, (we'd actually booked and paid for a Superior room) we asked for help with directions for our walk. Mark, one of the owners, quickly produced a guide book which he highlighted our route, gave us his personal insight and even let us borrow the book for our hike. Away from the spectacular private grounds of the Hotel we made the short hike to Little Langdale where we found the charming Slaters Bridge and onto the Cathedral Caves. I would strongly recommend the cave, you enter it through a tunnel before coming to a 80 ft high cave roof broken in two by a huge gorge that floods in light. The sound of dripping water from on high makes this a spectacular spot. We learned from Mark later on that it had recently been used in the making of the film 'Snow White & the Huntsman'. Back to the Hotel and to our perfectly spacious room, complete with complementary Grasmere Gingerbread. Dinner was tremendous - top notch food with excellent service. We certainly wasn't rushed but there certainly wasn't any kind of wait. The bar is well stocked with local ales, fine wine and an extensive spirits collection. We were lucky enough to sample the last of their home-made Damson gin which was out of this world (it only lasts for 4 months from Jan-Apr so think on)....Many residents were using wireless devices of one kind or other, laptops, phones, iPads, but we found the WiFi signal still strong enough to watch a 90 minute TV programme on iPlayer from one of the beautiful lounges. At the end of the night we was asked by the Bar tender whether we'd like a last drink before he closed the bar. I thought this was a really nice touch as he knew we'd been enjoying our programme from the Lounge and weren't to know the bar was closing. All in all this Hotel is wonderful. It oozes class and taste, food & service are flawless. Breakfast was a choice of about 4 cooked options with cereals, fruit, yoghurts and pastry beforehand if you want it. I think what makes this Hotel stand out is the service and individuality. We will definitely be going back and I'd strongly recommend it to anyone else.
reviews.title: Perfect in every sense

reviews.text: We booked this break only a week ago and I searched the web for a high quality but reasonably priced hotel to take my partner away for Easter.... The website just does not do this hotel justice - the views are stunning from our room and from the various 'public' areas around the hotel. The rooms appear to have struck that balance between retaining the charm of an old place with the modern convienience required to enjoy a short break of this type. What swung it for me was that you also get access to the Langdale hotel spa and gym facilities, which is just up the road. We eat at the hotel last night and it was superb. Breakfast is taken in a room with stunning views of the lake and is just fabulous -
reviews.title: The best hotel in the lake district!
